column4: Can anybody help me diagnose a different Xorg problem? I'm trying to get fglrx to work and...it's not. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/20226
we need the X log file, not the xorg.conf (or at least in addition to the xorg.conf)
remind me, what is your problem again?  I know I asked you to paste your log file, but I don't remember what we were talking about  :)
trying to get fglrx to work ;)
according to the log, fglrx is working
I would tell it to not use the frame buffer
doesn't seem like it: fglrxinfo reports "OpenGL vendor string: Mesa project: www.mesa3d.org"
where do I tell it not to use the framebuffer?
I do it with dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
just leave it the way dpkg already has it?
as long as it correctly identified your monitor
one last xorg.conf thing: if dpkg added a bunch of Tablet PC-only stuff to my xorg.conf, can I safely comment it out? I don't have a tablet ;)
